item.title: 'We've got a little fat guy who will turn him inside out' - the genius of Robertson
item.description: John Robertson, who has died aged 72, was dubbed "the Picasso of football" and made Brian Clough's great Nottingham Forest side tick, says chief football writer Phil McNulty.

item.title: All your FPL stats and Premier League team news in one place
item.description: Every key bit of Premier League team news and the most important Fantasy Premier League statistics - all in one place.

item.title: What to look out for in EFL's Boxing Day programme
item.description: BBC Sport takes a look at five things to keep an eye on in the EFL's Boxing Day fixture list

item.title: 'Picasso' of football Robertson dies aged 72
item.description: Former Scotland, Nottingham Forest and Derby County winger John Robertson - once described by manager Brian Clough as "a Picasso of our game" - dies at the age of 72.

item.title: Sutton's predictions v The Wellermen's Jonny Stewart
item.description: BBC Sport football expert Chris Sutton takes on The Wellermen's Jonny Stewart - and AI - with his predictions for this weekend's Premier League fixtures.

item.title: Saudi Pro League clubs target Joelinton - Friday's gossip
item.description: Newcastle United's Joelinton is a target for Saudi Pro League clubs, Oscar Bobb could leave Manchester City if they sign Antoine Semenyo, Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner is not intending to sign a new deal with the club, plus more.

item.title: Newcastle stadium plans in limbo - Howe
item.description: Eddie Howe says Newcastle's stadium and training ground plans are "in limbo" and there is a "99.9% chance" he will not be in charge when they are realised.

item.title: Players can only leave if replacements come in - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim is not willing to let any players leave in the January transfer window unless replacements come in.

item.title: Robertson was 'the scruffy fat lad who conquered Europe twice'
item.description: Those who know him best look back on the illustrious career of John Robertson, Nottingham Forest's double European Cup winner.

item.title: How to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend
item.description: BBC Sport Ask Me Anything explains how to follow the Premier League on the BBC this weekend.

item.title: Take on our BBC Gameshows ultimate football quiz
item.description: We've built five quizzes to celebrate five BBC shows - but only those with the biggest football trivia brains can beat them all.

item.title: The final Christmas Day fixture in England - 60 years on
item.description: This year marks the 60th anniversary since the final Football League match was played on Christmas Day in England.

item.title: Impossible to replace Fernandes - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is "impossible" to replace captain Bruno Fernandes, who is set for up to a month out with injury, but other players "must step up".

item.title: 'Come on Pep!' - Dyche's response to Guardiola's weight demands
item.description: Sean Dyche has told his Nottingham Forest players to "enjoy themselves" but "use common sense" over Christmas, after Pep Guardiola said Man City's players will be weighed when they return to training to check their fitness has not dropped over the festive period.

item.title: Jimenez penalty enough to earn Fulham win over Forest
item.description: Raul Jimenez's first-half penalty proves enough for Fulham to get their Premier League season back on track with a hard-fought win at home to Nottingham Forest.

item.title: Slot frustrated as Liverpool set to lose Isak for 'long time'
item.description: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says he expects to lose Alexander Isak for "a couple of months" after the striker was injured in a tackle by Tottenham's Micky van de Ven - a challenge that Slot has called "reckless".

item.title: Sitting with Ferguson and getting 'knocked out' - a photographer's tales
item.description: Magi Haroun, the first Premier League-accredited female photographer, shares her stories about sitting in the dugout with Sir Alex Ferguson and more.

item.title: 'Impossible to replace' - Fernandes could miss up to a month
item.description: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim says it is "impossible" to replace Bruno Fernandes as he faces up to a month without him.

item.title: Ex-poker player Bord is preferred Sheff Wed bidder
item.description: Former professional poker player James Bord is chosen as the preferred bidder for Sheffield Wednesday, BBC Sport can confirm.

item.title: Mr Tumble, Calzaghe, Big Dunc - what we've learned about Rooney
item.description: Disliking Mr Tumble, trying to fight Joe Calzaghe and writing to Duncan Ferguson in jail - what we have learned from The Wayne Rooney Show.

item.title: EFL Quiz of the Year: Who has been breaking records in 2025?
item.description: From record-breakers to dire financial situations, there's been much to talk about in the English Football League in 2025 - but do you remember the finer details?

item.title: How to save your FPL season with a few brave choices
item.description: No matter how far back you are in your FPL mini-league, there's always a way to recover - you just need to make some brave choices.

item.title: 'Why I was always driving home for Christmas'
item.description: In his BBC Sport column, ex-Premier League boss Tony Pulis reflects on what the festive period was like as a player and manager.

item.title: 'Always hungry, always brave' - why Man City want Semenyo
item.description: Every transfer window, there is a player whose future becomes the defining saga of the month. This January, it looks set to be Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo.

item.title: How to survive Christmas period - the FPL talking point
item.description: With four deadlines in 11 days, FPL expert Pras Singhal gives five tips to stay ahead of the curve over the festive period.

item.title: Why Hollywood battle could change how you watch sport
item.description: A multi-billion dollar takeover fight is being played out in Hollywood - and Premier League bosses will be watching on closely.

item.title: Why football at Christmas is a very British tradition
item.description: Mob football, Bank Holiday legislation and the strange tradition of too much football at Christmas.

item.title: How will Liverpool cope without Isak?
item.description: BBC Sport analyses how Liverpool manager Arne Slot might set up following striker Alexander Isak being ruled out for about two months with a broken leg.

item.title: Nancy wants 'really happy' Maeda to stay at Celtic
item.description: Celtic manager Wilfried Nancy is eager to retain Daizen Maeda and insists the forward is "really happy" at the Scottish champions after a possible summer exit was blocked.

item.title: Man City in advanced talks with Bournemouth's Semenyo
item.description: Antoine Semenyo is set to make a final decision on his future with Manchester City in advanced talks over a January move for the Bournemouth forward.

item.title: Captain Ekitike and triple Arsenal defence - FPL team of the week
item.description: Liverpool might score a hatful at home to Wolves this week and it would be rude not to get at least one attacking asset in your FPL team, writes Thomas Woods.

item.title: Silva delighted with 'massive' three points
item.description: Fulham boss Marco Silva is delighted with the "massive" three points his side took following a 1-0 win over Nottingham Forest at Craven Cottage.

item.title: Forest not 'clear-headed enough' against Fulham - Dyche
item.description: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche says his team's "basics" were not quite what they should have been in their 1-0 defeat away to Fulham.

item.title: Stunning Rogers double secures Villa win over Man Utd
item.description: Morgan Rogers scores twice for Aston Villa in their 2-1 win against Manchester United, extending Villa's unbeaten run to 10 matches in all competitions.

item.title: How Rogers and Villa exposed Man Utd defence
item.description: Match of the Day pundit Dion Dublin analyses what went wrong for Manchester United against Aston Villa, and Wayne Rooney discusses the World Cup potential of "man of the moment" Morgan Rogers.

item.title: Watch: Celtic's McAneny scores after just four seconds
item.description: Celtic's Maria McAneny gets her team off to an audacious start against Hibernian by scoring straight from kick-off in Sunday's SWPL victory.

item.title: Chelsea hammer nine goals past Liverpool in Women's League Cup
item.description: Chelsea put nine past Liverpool in the Women's League Cup to progress to the semi-finals, as Sam Kerr scores the opening two goals and Johanna Rytting Kaneryd completes a hat-trick.

item.title: Afcon 'bringing hope' to Sudan amid civil war
item.description: Sudan's participation in the Africa Cup of Nations is "bringing hope" to the country amid its civil war, forward Abobaker Eisa says.

item.title: Why Mbappe had £1.3m ethics bonus in PSG contract
item.description: Paris St-Germain were told they must hand over a £1.3m "ethics bonus" to Kylian Mbappe as part of his court battle win - what are these payments?

item.title: Dyche urges 'common sense' rather than weigh players like Guardiola
item.description: Nottingham Forest boss Sean Dyche urges his players to show "common sense" over Christmas after Pep Guardiola says he will weigh his squad on their return.

item.title: Oxford sack Rowett after one win in 10 games
item.description: Oxford United head coach Gary Rowett is sacked with the club in the Championship relegation zone.

item.title: Do footballers train on Christmas Day?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team looks at why footballers train on Christmas Day and how players feel about it.

item.title: Penalty king Jimenez equals record - who are the Premier League's best?
item.description: Fulham's Raul Jimenez scored his 11th Premier League penalty from 11 attempts, but who are the best spot-kick takers?

item.title: Explaining Celtic manager Nancy's 'unusual' tactics
item.description: Analysing Wilfried Nancy's tactical approach, why his Columbus Crew side impressed and what he is trying to create at Celtic.

item.title: The best team today lost - Amorim
item.description: Manchester United Manager Ruben Amorim says that Manchester United performed better despite losing 2-1 to Aston Villa.

item.title: Emery elated with 'fantastic' Aston Villa win
item.description: Aston Villa manager Unai Emery praises his "fantastic" players in a hard-fought 2-1 win against Manchester United.

item.title: Can Aston Villa sustain a title challenge?
item.description: Football Focus's Alex Scott, Nedum Onuoha and Glenn Murray look at Aston Villa's incredible Premier League form and whether they can sustain a title challenge this season.

item.title: Who are the contenders to win Afcon?
item.description: BBC Sport's John Bennett gives Football Focus the lowdown on which nations are contenders to win the Africa Cup of Nations, which begins in Morocco on Sunday.

item.title: Given shares Howe's frustrations on trio of decisions
item.description: Match of the Day's Shay Given shares Newcastle manager Eddie Howe's frustrations after a trio of decisions went against the Magpies in their 2-2 draw with Chelsea.

item.title: Who could succeed Guardiola at Man City?
item.description: At least two candidates have already been identified as potential replacements for Pep Guardiola, but who could take over from him at Manchester City?

item.title: Top and bottom at Christmas - what does it mean?
item.description: As we approach the halfway point of the season, what do the ghosts of Christmas past tell us about the Premier League title race and relegation battle?

item.title: Tomori on Tuchel, living in Italy and why this is the best he has felt
item.description: Fikayo Tomori says his success at AC Milan shows English players "can go abroad and adapt to a different way of living".

item.title: Fifa tests new technology for ball out of play and offside
item.description: Fifa is testing new technology which can determine if the ball went out of play before a goal was scored.

item.title: How could Man Utd replace injured Fernandes?
item.description: Manchester United are still evaluating the extent of Bruno Fernandes' injury, but who are the contenders to replace him if he is ruled out?

item.title: Gyokeres taking penalty was a surprise to me - Arteta
item.description: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says he was surprised to see Viktor Gyokeres step up to take his team's penalty in the 1-0 win at Everton and says the decision was made by the players.

item.title: O'Brien shouldn't have raised arms for penalty - Moyes
item.description: Everton manager David Moyes says he has "no complaints" about the penalty which gave Arsenal a 1-0 win, after the ball hit Jake O'Brien's raised arms in the box.

item.title: Slot delighted with 'unbelievable' win against nine-man Spurs
item.description: Arne Slot says Liverpool were fortunate to win their "unbelievable" match against nine-man Tottenham.

item.title: Frank proud of players 'unbelievable mentality' in defeat against Liverpool
item.description: Tottenham boss Thomas Frank is proud of his players "unbelievable mentality" as nine-man Spurs nearly earned a draw at home to Liverpool.

item.title: Late Broja goal eases 'massive pressure' on struggling Burnley - Parker
item.description: Burnley manager Scott Parker praises his side for overcoming "massive pressure" in their 1-1 draw against Bournemouth.

item.title: 'Just reach out' - Man Utd's Bennett on his father's suicide
item.description: Manchester United defender Rhys Bennett discusses his father's death in October to help raise awareness of mental health issues.

item.title: Mancini, sibling rivalry and wanting to excite fans - the Yaya Toure story
item.description: Yaya Toure reflects on a glittering career at clubs such as Barcelona and Manchester City as well as with his country, Ivory Coast.

item.title: McTominay-style finish - but what else did Scots learn about Morocco?
item.description: Hosts Morocco kick off the Africa Cup of Nations with a win over Comoros - but what did we discover about Scotland's World Cup opponents?

item.title: England's X-factor has 'hill to climb' - will Palmer go to World Cup?
item.description: Does Cole Palmer still have hope of making England's World Cup squad? BBC Sport chief football writer Phil McNulty examines the Chelsea star's chances.

item.title: Best player? Surprise package? Review of WSL so far
item.description: Former England internationals Ellen White and Fara Williams review the Women's Super League season so far as we head into a winter break.

item.title: Transfers - September to December 2025
item.description: Check out the significant signings and departures in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, EFL and Women's Super League.

item.title: Manager ins and outs - 2025-26 season
item.description: BBC Sport tracks all the manager ins and outs in the Premier League, Scottish Premiership, Women's Super League, English Football League and National League.

item.title: Is a leg break worse than an ACL tear?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team look at the different recovery periods for common football injuries.

item.title: Who's leading the race for the Golden Shoe?
item.description: As the halfway mark of the 2025-26 campaign approaches, BBC Sport takes a look at the frontrunners for this season's European Golden Shoe award.

item.title: Spain to face Argentina in Finalissima - but what is it?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain when and where the 2026 Finalissima is.

item.title: Why is there only one Premier League game on Sunday?
item.description: BBC Sport's Ask Me Anything team explains why there is just one Premier League match on Sunday this weekend

item.title: Unlucky to miss out? Who makes the alternative World XI?
item.description: The Fifa Best Men's XI was announced on Tuesday in Qatar, but who was unfortunate to miss out? BBC Sport takes a look at an alternative World XI.

item.title: Why have footballers started their own YouTube channels?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why football players have started their own YouTube channels.

item.title: Why are the queues to enter Anfield growing?
item.description: Our Ask Me Anything team explain why Liverpool fans have been asked to arrive at Anfield 10 minutes earlier than usual.

item.title: Rangers 'initiate' talks with contract rebel Ekwah - gossip
item.description: Rangers hold talks with French midfielder, while Celtic weigh up a move for Ivorian winger.

item.title: Watch live Bundesliga games on Friday nights on the BBC
item.description: BBC Sport announce broadcasting rights for Bundesliga matches for the 2025-26 and 2026-27 seasons.

item.title: Maccabi Tel Aviv given suspended one-match away fan ban
item.description: Maccabi Tel Aviv receive a suspended one-match away fan ban by Uefa after racist chanting during their Europa League game against Stuttgart.

item.title: PSG ordered to pay Mbappe 60m euros
item.description: Paris St-Germain are ordered to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60m euros (£52.5m) in unpaid salary and bonuses by a French court.

item.title: Dembele wins Fifa Best men's player of the year
item.description: Paris St-Germain and France forward Ousmane Dembele is named the men's player of the year at the Fifa Best awards.

item.title: Lewandowski in Chicago Fire talks over MLS move
item.description: Chicago Fire are in pole position to sign Barcelona striker Robert Lewandowski in the summer on a free transfer.

item.title: Precheur gone - so what's next for London City?
item.description: When London City Lionesses sacked manager Jocelyn Precheur it sparked controversy - but they are a club who have always done things differently.

item.title: London City set to appoint Maestre as manager
item.description: London City Lionesses are set to appoint Spanish coach Edere Maestre as manager following the sacking of Jocelyn Precheur.

item.title: West Ham appoint Guarino as manager
item.description: Women's Super League side West Ham appoint Rita Guarino as manager following the sacking of Rehanne Skinner.

item.title: Scott 'honoured' to replace Sadiku as Celtic head coach
item.description: Former title-winning manager Elena Sadiku has left Celtic and has been replaced by Hibernian boss Grant Scott.

item.title: London City Lionesses sack manager Precheur
item.description: London City Lionesses sack manager Jocelyn Precheur midway through their debut season in the Women's Super League.

item.title: Chelsea put nine past Liverpool in Women's League Cup
item.description: Chelsea hammer Liverpool 9-1 to reach the Women's League Cup semi-finals, while Manchester City, Manchester United and Arsenal also progress.

item.title: The great number nine decline - where have England's strikers gone?
item.description: BBC Sport takes an in-depth look at why England lack centre-forward options behind Harry Kane - a far cry from when the likes of Les Ferdinand only won 17 caps.

item.title: Captain, player, manager, Mister, number one - Davids at Barnet
item.description: BBC Sport remembers Edgar Davids' 15 months as Barnet player-manager in League Two and the Conference.

item.title: From farming village to Liverpool icon - the Salah story
item.description: BBC Sport visits Egypt to discover what Mohamed Salah means to the people of the football-mad country, and how a small boy from humble beginnings became a national icon.

item.title: Napoli 'smell blood' & target Premier League's discarded stars
item.description: After Scott McTominay was a hit, Napoli went back to the Premier League for Kevin de Bruyne, could more players follow them to Serie A?

item.title: When River Plate icon Diaz took over fourth-tier Oxford
item.description: Twenty years on from Ramon Diaz's surprising appointment at Oxford United, BBC Sport looks at what happened and how it went.

item.title: East meets west London - the mentor who changed Chelsea
item.description: Vinay Menon knew nothing about football when he went for a meeting at a west London mansion in 2009. A few weeks later he was in the heart of the Chelsea dressing room.

item.title: The air crash and the underdogs - a triumph for a lost generation
item.description: Nineteen years and 10 miles separated Zambia's football team from a lost, golden generation on a fateful night in Libreville.
